headline.main: Liberty and Security in the Age of Terror

lead_paragraph: To the Editor: I thank William Safire (column, Nov. 15) for having the courage to speak out against the outrage of President Bush's dictator-style ''military courts.'' At a time when even the American Civil Liberties Union must be careful about appearing to be against the war on terrorism, we need as many people as possible to assure that the short step from rounding up some noncitizen suspects to trying and sentencing them on secret evidence never takes place. SUMITA PAHWA Baltimore, Nov. 15, 2001
abstract: Sumita Pahwa letter lauds William Safire (Nov 15) for having courage to speak out against outrage of Pres Bush's 'dictator-style' military courts
